article_text:
Until Monday’s 4-1 matinee victory over visiting Detroit, the Islanders were undeniably light in the “quality wins” department. Specifically, they were a pitiful 0-8-1 against Eastern Conference playoff contenders Washington, Pittsburgh, Boston, Florida, and the Red Wings, the latter of whom had outscored the Isles 9-3 over their previous two meetings.

Now, ahead of Thursday’s home game against the NHL-best Capitals, the Islanders...

twitter.description: The Islanders are building the kind of offensive momentum they had last year, when they finished tied for third in scoring.
twitter.title: The Islanders’ Defense Gets Offensive
